content.rendered:
Dr Morris A. Anglin is the Head of School and oversees the academic operational management for the School of Allied Health. He achieved his MSc, summa cum laude in Public Health at Tulane School of Public Health and Tropical Medicine, Louisiana, USA. Prior to that, he worked at the Yale School of Medicine conducting research in Epidemiology and Public Health and have over 15 years working in a hospital setting. He has worked as Head of Health and Social Care for the past 6 years overseeing a successful department. He has a background in public health and pharmacy with a strong interest in Environmental Public Health. His PhD research interest have been in Environmental Epidemiology and Environmental Cardiology. He has presented his work at national and international conferences.

What he likes most about teaching is seeing the “light bulb” go off for a non-traditional student. For non-traditional students especially coming back to education it may be developing academic and interpersonal skills to overcoming their fear of public speaking and delivering a successful speech. For students who have been struggling academically, it might be achieving a grade because you know as non-traditional students, the sacrifices they have made and how they have worked hard to achieve their grades so that they can either gain achieve their dream. All of these light bulb moments are special and motivates him to keep teaching.
